author: Lehofan678
title: Good for a promo
review:
I got this set out of a nat geo kids magazine and i thoroughly enjoyed building it. 

The magazine itself cost around £4 but it was definitely worth it to get that Lego set.

It included the special mosquito print on the 1x2 round transparent piece which was an added bonus and a neat simple way to easily get to it in the build. 

I would recommend buying it but be careful where you but it from because some places sell it for almost £7, but i liked it and i hope you like it too. 

Lehofan678

author: Puidwen
title: A nice, but a very simple set.
review: i got this on sale.  One thing is this set has absolutely no extra parts.  It does have a few unique parts,  but that doesn't save it from looking simple.  It was enjoyable to throw together.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Arctic Polybag Fun, Limited Play Funcions.
review:
Set #30360 Arctic Ice Saw: Arctic returned in strong form with LEGO City in 2018 and this Polybag is a great way to get some fun out of the Theme if you’re interested in some parts.

Pros:

  • Great looking City Minifigure with Blue Tuque and some great printing.
  • Model is solid and fun to play with as well as quick to build.
  • Printed cylinder with insect remains included

Cons:

  • May have benefited from extra Arctic elements to find hidden in the small snow-mound model.

Overall opinion

This Polybag was a great little bag and I enjoyed it immensely. I strongly recommend tracking it down for the parts and the fun younger fans will have building and exploring in the Arctic City Theme. Makes a great addition/compliment to any of the larger sets and is a great troop builder for arctic explorers to populate the Arctic region of LEGO City.

author: ETH_BAIl
title: A decent polybag, but not anything special by any means.
review:
Pros:

The build uses some pieces in a interesting and useful way.

The pieces included are useful for other things, so it is a "Parts Pack".

The minifigure in an army builder for an arctic team or something

Affordable

Play feature is easy to play around with.

 

Cons:

Minifigure in generic, but this may be a good thing.

Nothing to special

 

Final thoughts:

This set has more Pros than Cons, however, the fact that the build is nothing to special weighs it down a little bit. This polybag is a good value for the pieces, the price, and the minifigure. I would rate it a B+
